intro: Spennera fragilis, commonly known as the brittle spennera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Spennera fragilis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its fragility and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
